ciscoIetfPimExtMIB.name: ciscoIetfPimExtMIB

revisions.description: Added ciscoIetfPimExtNotifs, cpimExtInterfaceStateChangeNotifEnabled, cpimExtRPMappingChangeNotifEnabled, ciscoIetfPimExtInterfaceUp, ciscoIetfPimExtInterfaceDown, ciscoIetfPimExtRPMappingChange, ciscoIetfPimExtMIBComplianceRev1, ciscoIetfPimExtNotifEnabledGroup, ciscoIetfPimExtNotificationGroup
Initial version of this MIB module

ciscoIetfPimExtMIB.contactinfo: Cisco Systems Customer Service Postal: 170 W Tasman Drive San Jose, CA 95134 Tel: +1 800 553-NETS E-mail: cs-ipmulticast@cisco.com
ciscoIetfPimExtMIB.description: The MIB module which extends PIM management capabilities defined in CISCO-IETF-PIM-MIB.

cpimExtIfTable.name: cpimExtIfTable
cpimExtIfTable.description: The (conceptual) table listing the router's PIM interfaces. IGMP and PIM are enabled on all interfaces listed in this table. This table is augmented to cPimIfTable

cpimExtIfEntry.name: cpimExtIfEntry
cpimExtIfEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the cpimExtIfTable. Each entry represents multicast related interface configuration and operational states. An interface can have more than one type of Inet address family enabled and there will be one entry per interface and address family version

cpimExtIfTrigHelloInterval.name: cpimExtIfTrigHelloInterval
cpimExtIfTrigHelloInterval.description: The maximum time before a triggered PIM Hello message is transmitted on this interface.

cpimExtIfHelloHoldtime.name: cpimExtIfHelloHoldtime
cpimExtIfHelloHoldtime.description: The value set in the Holdtime field of Hello messages transmitted on this interface. This should be 3.5 times the value of cPimInterfaceHelloInterval.

cpimExtIfLanPruneDelay.name: cpimExtIfLanPruneDelay
cpimExtIfLanPruneDelay.description: Turns the LAN Prune Delay Option off and on on this interface.

cpimExtIfPropagationDelay.name: cpimExtIfPropagationDelay
cpimExtIfPropagationDelay.description: The value inserted into the LAN Prune Delay field of a LAN Prune Delay option on this interface.

cpimExtIfOverrideInterval.name: cpimExtIfOverrideInterval
cpimExtIfOverrideInterval.description: The value inserted into the Override Interval field of a LAN Prune Delay option on this interface.

cpimExtIfGenerationID.name: cpimExtIfGenerationID
cpimExtIfGenerationID.description: Turns the Generation ID Option off and on on this interface. Generation ID is a random value for the interface and is used to determine neighbor restart

cpimExtIfJoinPruneHoldtime.name: cpimExtIfJoinPruneHoldtime
cpimExtIfJoinPruneHoldtime.description: The value inserted into the Holdtime field of a Join/ Prune message sent on this interface. The value should be 3.5 times cPimInterfaceJoinPruneInterval.

cpimExtIfGraftRetryInterval.name: cpimExtIfGraftRetryInterval
cpimExtIfGraftRetryInterval.description: The interval a PIM router waits for a Graft Ack before resending a Graft on this interface.

cpimExtIfMaxGraftRetries.name: cpimExtIfMaxGraftRetries
cpimExtIfMaxGraftRetries.description: The maximum number of times this router will resend a Graft on this interface.

cpimExtIfSRTTLThreshold.name: cpimExtIfSRTTLThreshold
cpimExtIfSRTTLThreshold.description: The Time To Live in a PIM-DM State Refresh message at which it is not forwarded on this interface.

cpimExtIfLanDelayEnabled.name: cpimExtIfLanDelayEnabled
cpimExtIfLanDelayEnabled.description: Evaluates to 'true' if all routers on this interface are using the LAN Prune Delay Option.

cpimExtIfSRCapable.name: cpimExtIfSRCapable
cpimExtIfSRCapable.description: Evaluates to 'true' if all routers on this interface are using the State Refresh Capable Option.

cpimExtIfDRPriority.name: cpimExtIfDRPriority
cpimExtIfDRPriority.description: The Designater Router Priority inserted into the DR priority option on this interface.

cpimExtIfBidirCapable.name: cpimExtIfBidirCapable
cpimExtIfBidirCapable.description: Evaluates to 'true' if all routers on this interface are using the Bidirectional-PIM Capable Option.

cpimExtIfBSRBorder.name: cpimExtIfBSRBorder
cpimExtIfBSRBorder.description: This object denotes whether this interface acts as the border for all BSR messages for all groups with any scope.

cpimExtNbrTable.name: cpimExtNbrTable
cpimExtNbrTable.description: The (conceptual) table listing the router's PIM neighbors. This table is augmented to cPimNbrTable

cpimExtNbrEntry.name: cpimExtNbrEntry
cpimExtNbrEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the cpimExtNbrTable. Each entry is indexed using interface ifIndex though which neighbor is reachable and InetAddress that is used for communicating with this neighbor

cpimExtNbrLANPruneDelay.name: cpimExtNbrLANPruneDelay
cpimExtNbrLANPruneDelay.description: The value of LAN Prune Delay field of the LAN Prune Delay Option received from this neighbor. A value of 0 indicates that no LAN Prune Delay Option was received from this neigbor.

cpimExtNbrOverrideInterval.name: cpimExtNbrOverrideInterval
cpimExtNbrOverrideInterval.description: The value of Override Interval field of the LAN Prune Delay Option received from this neighbor. A value of 0 indicates that no LAN Prune Delay Option was received from this neighbor.

cpimExtNbrTBit.name: cpimExtNbrTBit
cpimExtNbrTBit.description: The value of the T bit field of the LAN Prune Delay Option received from this neighbor. The T bit specifies the ability of the neighbor to disable join suppression.

cpimExtNbrSRCapable.name: cpimExtNbrSRCapable
cpimExtNbrSRCapable.description: Evaluates to 'true' if this neighbor is using the State Refresh Capable Option.

cpimExtNbrGenId.name: cpimExtNbrGenId
cpimExtNbrGenId.description: The value of the GenerationID received in the Hello from the neighbor.

cpimExtNbrBidirCapable.name: cpimExtNbrBidirCapable
cpimExtNbrBidirCapable.description: Evaluates to 'true' if this neighbor is using the Bidirectional-PIM Capable Option.

cpimExtNbrDRPresent.name: cpimExtNbrDRPresent
cpimExtNbrDRPresent.description: Evaluates to 'true' if this neighbor is using the Designated Router Option.

cpimExtNbrDRPriority.name: cpimExtNbrDRPriority
cpimExtNbrDRPriority.description: The value of the Designated Router Priority received in the Hello from the neighbor, if the cpimExtNbrDRPresent is 'true'.

cpimExtNbrSecAddressTable.name: cpimExtNbrSecAddressTable
cpimExtNbrSecAddressTable.description: The (conceptual) table listing the Secondary InetAddresses advertised by each PIM neighbor (on a subset of the rows of the cPimNbrTable defined in CISCO-IETF-PIM-MIB).

cpimExtNbrSecAddressEntry.name: cpimExtNbrSecAddressEntry
cpimExtNbrSecAddressEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the cPimNbrSecAddressTable. Each entry represents secondary InetAddresses that can be used to reach the corresponding neighbor.

cpimExtNbrSecAddress.name: cpimExtNbrSecAddress
cpimExtNbrSecAddress.description: The Secondary Inetddress of the PIM Neighbor. Type of InetAddress presented in this object is same as that of cPimNbrAddressType in INDEX clause

cpimExtNbrSecMask.name: cpimExtNbrSecMask
cpimExtNbrSecMask.description: The network mask for the Inet address presented in cpimExtNbrSecAddress

cpimExtMRouteTable.name: cpimExtMRouteTable
cpimExtMRouteTable.description: The (conceptual) table listing PIM-specific information on a subset of the rows of the cIpMRouteTable defined in the IP Multicast MIB. This table is augmented to cPimInetMRouteTable

cpimExtMRouteEntry.name: cpimExtMRouteEntry
cpimExtMRouteEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the cpimExtIPMRouteTable. There is one entry per entry in the cIpMRouteTable whose incoming interface is running PIM.

cpimExtMRouteRPFNeighbor.name: cpimExtMRouteRPFNeighbor
cpimExtMRouteRPFNeighbor.description: The Inetaddress of the current RPF neighbor. If there is an upstream Assert Winner, it will be the RPF neighbor. Otherwise, the RPF neighbor will be the next hop indicated by unicast routing. Type of InetAddress presented in this object is same as that of cIpMRouteAddrType in INDEX

cpimExtMRouteSourceTimer.name: cpimExtMRouteSourceTimer
cpimExtMRouteSourceTimer.description: The time before this router ceases originating State Refresh messages for this route.

cpimExtMRouteOriginatorSRTTL.name: cpimExtMRouteOriginatorSRTTL
cpimExtMRouteOriginatorSRTTL.description: The TTL used in State Refresh messages originated by this router for this route.

cpimExtMRouteBidirGroup.name: cpimExtMRouteBidirGroup
cpimExtMRouteBidirGroup.description: Evaluates to 'true' if this entry represents a Bidir-PIM route.

cpimExtMRouteNextHopTable.name: cpimExtMRouteNextHopTable
cpimExtMRouteNextHopTable.description: The (conceptual) table listing PIM-specific information on a subset of the rows of the cIpMRouteNextHopTable defined in the IP Multicast Routing Table MIB - IPMROUTE-MIB. This table is augmented to cPimInetMRouteNextHopTable

cpimExtMRouteNextHopEntry.name: cpimExtMRouteNextHopEntry
cpimExtMRouteNextHopEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the cpimExtMRouteNextHopTable. There is one entry per entry in the cPimInetMRouteNextHopTable whose interface is running PIM and whose cIpMRouteNextHopState is pruned(1).

cpimExtMRouteNextHopAssertWinner.name: cpimExtMRouteNextHopAssertWinner
cpimExtMRouteNextHopAssertWinner.description: The Inetaddress of the Assert Winner. Type of InetAddress presented in this object is same as that of cIpMRouteNextHopAddrType in INDEX

cpimExtMRouteNextHopAssertTimer.name: cpimExtMRouteNextHopAssertTimer
cpimExtMRouteNextHopAssertTimer.description: The time remaining before the PIM router leaves the current Assert state. A value of 0 indicates that the router is in the No Info state.

cpimExtMRouteNextHopAssertMetric.name: cpimExtMRouteNextHopAssertMetric
cpimExtMRouteNextHopAssertMetric.description: The metric advertised by the Assert Winner.

cpimExtMRouteNextHopAsrtMtrcPref.name: cpimExtMRouteNextHopAsrtMtrcPref
cpimExtMRouteNextHopAsrtMtrcPref.description: The metric preference advertised by the Assert Winner.

cpimExtMRouteNextHopJoinPruneTmr.name: cpimExtMRouteNextHopJoinPruneTmr
cpimExtMRouteNextHopJoinPruneTmr.description: The time remaining before the PIM router reverts to default operation on this interface. PIM-SM will cease forwarding, PIM-DM will resume forwarding.

cpimExtBidirDFTable.name: cpimExtBidirDFTable
cpimExtBidirDFTable.description: The (conceptual) table listing the Per-RP DF (Designated Forwarder) Election state for each interface for all the RPs in Bidir mode.

cpimExtBidirDFEntry.name: cpimExtBidirDFEntry
cpimExtBidirDFEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the cpimExtBidirDFTable. Each entry represents details about DF winner for each RP per interface.

cpimExtBidirDFIfIndex.name: cpimExtBidirDFIfIndex
cpimExtBidirDFIfIndex.description: The value of ifIndex for the interface for which the DF state is being maintained.

cpimExtBidirDFRPAddressType.name: cpimExtBidirDFRPAddressType
cpimExtBidirDFRPAddressType.description: The type of Inetaddress of the RP for which the DF state is being maintained.

cpimExtBidirDFRPAddress.name: cpimExtBidirDFRPAddress
cpimExtBidirDFRPAddress.description: The Inetaddress of the RP for which the DF state is being maintained. Type of InetAddress presented in this object is same as that of cpimExtBidirDFRPAddressType in INDEX clause

cpimExtBidirDFWinnerAddress.name: cpimExtBidirDFWinnerAddress
cpimExtBidirDFWinnerAddress.description: The Inetaddress of the winner of the DF Election process. Type of InetAddress presented in this object is same as that of cpimExtBidirDFRPAddressType in INDEX clause

cpimExtBidirDFWinnerUptime.name: cpimExtBidirDFWinnerUptime
cpimExtBidirDFWinnerUptime.description: The time interval for which this DF is being used.

cpimExtBidirDFWnrMtrcPref.name: cpimExtBidirDFWnrMtrcPref
cpimExtBidirDFWnrMtrcPref.description: The metric preference advertised by the DF Winner.

cpimExtBidirDFWinnerMetric.name: cpimExtBidirDFWinnerMetric
cpimExtBidirDFWinnerMetric.description: The metric advertised by the DF Winner.

cpimExtBidirDFState.name: cpimExtBidirDFState
cpimExtBidirDFState.description: The state of this interface wrt DF-Election wrt this RP. unknown (0) indicates that there is no election state on the interface. dfOffer (1) indicates the initial election state in which the winner offers its metrics thinking it might eventually become winner. dfLose (2) indicates the state in which the router knows that there either is a different election winner or that no router on the link has a path to the RP. dfWinner (3) indicates the router is the acting DF without any contest. dfBackoff (4) indicates the router is the acting DF but another router has made a bid to take over.

cpimExtBidirDFStateTimer.name: cpimExtBidirDFStateTimer
cpimExtBidirDFStateTimer.description: The time remaining before for which the router expires the current DF state represented by cpimExtBidirDFState.

cpimExtRPSetTable.name: cpimExtRPSetTable
cpimExtRPSetTable.description: The (conceptual) table listing PIM information for available Rendezvous Points (RPs) for IP multicast groups. An entry is learnt from one of {static, bsr, embedded} methods, as defined by the cpimExtRPSetType object. When the cpimExtRPSetType object has a value {static}, the entry is a mapping provided by user-configuration. A value of {embedded} indicates that the RP-address is embedded in the Group-address. When the value is {bsr}, this entry is obtained from received Candidate-RP-Advertisements when the local router is the BSR, and is obtained from received RP-Set messages when the local router is not the BSR.

cpimExtRPSetEntry.name: cpimExtRPSetEntry
cpimExtRPSetEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the cpimExtRPSetTable. Each entry represents details about RP per multicast group and how it is learned

cpimExtRPSetComponent.name: cpimExtRPSetComponent
cpimExtRPSetComponent.description: A number uniquely identifying the component. Each protocol instance connected to a separate domain should have a different index value.

cpimExtRPSetAddrType.name: cpimExtRPSetAddrType
cpimExtRPSetAddrType.description: The type of Inetaddress of the IP multicast group.

cpimExtRPSetGroupAddress.name: cpimExtRPSetGroupAddress
cpimExtRPSetGroupAddress.description: The IP multicast group address which, when combined with cpimExtRPSetGroupMask, gives the group prefix for which this entry contains information about the RP. Type of InetAddress presented in this object is same as that of cpimExtRPSetAddrType in INDEX clause

cpimExtRPSetGroupMask.name: cpimExtRPSetGroupMask
cpimExtRPSetGroupMask.description: The multicast group address mask which, when combined with cpimExtRPSetGroupAddress, gives the group prefix for which this entry contains information about the RP.

cpimExtRPSetType.name: cpimExtRPSetType
cpimExtRPSetType.description: This object indicates how the RP was learnt, 'static' means static (2) indicates entry was learnt from local configuration. bsr (3) indicates entry was learnt from BSR RP discovery protocol. embedded (4) indicates entry was learnt from Embedded-RP mechanism where the RP-Address is embedded in the Multicast Group address. autorp (5) indicates entry was learnt from Auto-Rendezvous-Point protocol, a Cisco proprietary protocol to dynamically distribute Group to RP mappings within an autonomous system.

cpimExtRPSetAddress.name: cpimExtRPSetAddress
cpimExtRPSetAddress.description: The Inet Address of the RP. Type of InetAddress presented in this object is same as that of cpimExtRPSetAddrType in INDEX clause

cpimExtRPSetHoldTime.name: cpimExtRPSetHoldTime
cpimExtRPSetHoldTime.description: The holdtime of the RP entry. In case of 'bsr' cpimExtRPSetType, if the local router is not the BSR, this value is 0.

cpimExtRPSetExpiryTime.name: cpimExtRPSetExpiryTime
cpimExtRPSetExpiryTime.description: The minimum time remaining before the RP denoted by this entry will be declared down. In case of 'bsr' cpimExtRPSetType, if the local router is not the BSR, this value is 0.

cpimExtRPSetPriority.name: cpimExtRPSetPriority
cpimExtRPSetPriority.description: The RP-priority in the C-RP Advertisements or the RP-Set messages from the BSR (with value 0 denoting the highest priority, default 192). Note that this field is valid only when cPimRPSetType is 'bsr', and for other types, this value will be -1.

cpimExtRPSetRPActive.name: cpimExtRPSetRPActive
cpimExtRPSetRPActive.description: Evaluates to 'true' if the RP in this entry is the currently active RP for the group-range.

cpimExtCRPTable.name: cpimExtCRPTable
cpimExtCRPTable.description: The (conceptual) table listing the IP multicast groups for which the local router is to advertise itself as a Candidate-RP when the value of cPimComponentCRPHoldTime is non-zero. If this table is empty, then the local router will advertise itself as a Candidate-RP for all groups (providing the value of cPimComponentCRPHoldTime is non- zero).

cpimExtCRPEntry.name: cpimExtCRPEntry
cpimExtCRPEntry.description: An entry (conceptual row) in the cpimExtCandidateRPTable. Each entry represents Bidir state of Candidate-RP

cpimExtCRPBidir.name: cpimExtCRPBidir
cpimExtCRPBidir.description: The Group for which this RP is advertised is a PIM-Bidir group or not.

cpimExtSourceLifetime.name: cpimExtSourceLifetime
cpimExtSourceLifetime.description: The maximum time this router will continue to originate State Refresh messages in the absence of traffic from the source itself.

cpimExtStateRefreshInterval.name: cpimExtStateRefreshInterval
cpimExtStateRefreshInterval.description: The interval between successive State Refresh messages originated by this router.

cpimExtStateRefreshLimitInterval.name: cpimExtStateRefreshLimitInterval
cpimExtStateRefreshLimitInterval.description: This router will not forward successive State Refresh messages received at less than this interval.

cpimExtStateRefreshTimeToLive.name: cpimExtStateRefreshTimeToLive
cpimExtStateRefreshTimeToLive.description: The TTL to be used by this router's originated State Refresh messages if the data packet's TTL is not recorded.

cpimExtInterfaceStateChangeNotifEnabled.name: cpimExtInterfaceStateChangeNotifEnabled
cpimExtInterfaceStateChangeNotifEnabled.description: An indication of whether ciscoIetfPimExtInterfaceUp and ciscoIetfPimExtInterfaceDown notifications are enabled.

cpimExtRPMappingChangeNotifEnabled.name: cpimExtRPMappingChangeNotifEnabled
cpimExtRPMappingChangeNotifEnabled.description: An indication of whether the ciscoIetfPimExtRPMappingChange notification is enabled.

ciscoIetfPimExtInterfaceUp.name: ciscoIetfPimExtInterfaceUp
ciscoIetfPimExtInterfaceUp.description: A ciscoIetfPimExtInterfaceUp notification signifies the restoration of a PIM interface. This notification should be generated whenever cPimIfStatus transitions into the 'active' state. cPimIfStatus identifies the interface which was involved in the generation of this notification.

ciscoIetfPimExtInterfaceDown.name: ciscoIetfPimExtInterfaceDown
ciscoIetfPimExtInterfaceDown.description: A ciscoIetfPimExtInterfaceDown notification signifies the loss of a PIM interface. This notification should be generated whenever an entry is about to be deleted from the cPimIfTable. cPimIfStatus identifies the interface which was involved in the generation of this notification.

ciscoIetfPimExtRPMappingChange.name: ciscoIetfPimExtRPMappingChange
ciscoIetfPimExtRPMappingChange.description: A ciscoIetfPimExtRPMappingChange notification signifies a change in the RP Mapping on the device in question. A change in RP Mapping could be because of addition of new entries to the RP Mapping cache, deletion of existing entries, or a modification to an existing mapping. The type of change is indicated by cpimRPMappingChangeType. cpimExtRPSetHoldTime is used to identify the row in the cpimExtRPSetTable that is responsible for the generation of this notification. In case of modification to existing entries, a notification should be generated once before the modification (with cpimRPMappingChangeType set to 'modifiedOldMapping') and once after modification (with cpimRPMappingChangeType set to 'modifiedNewMapping'). NOTE: A high frequency of RP Mapping change could result in a large number of ciscoIetfPimExtRPMappingChange notifications being generated. Hence, in environments where the possibility of a high frequency of RP Mapping change exists, enable this notification with utmost care.

ciscoIetfPimExtMIBCompliance.name: ciscoIetfPimExtMIBCompliance
ciscoIetfPimExtMIBCompliance.description: The compliance statement for routers running PIM and implementing the PIM MIB.

ciscoIetfPimExtMIBComplianceRev1.name: ciscoIetfPimExtMIBComplianceRev1
ciscoIetfPimExtMIBComplianceRev1.description: The compliance statement for routers running PIM and implementing the PIM MIB.

ciscoIetfPimExtGeneralGroup.name: ciscoIetfPimExtGeneralGroup
ciscoIetfPimExtGeneralGroup.description: A collection of objects to support management of PIM routers

ciscoIetfPimExtNbrGroup.name: ciscoIetfPimExtNbrGroup
ciscoIetfPimExtNbrGroup.description: A collection of objects to support management of PIM neighbors

ciscoIetfPimExtNextHopGroup.name: ciscoIetfPimExtNextHopGroup
ciscoIetfPimExtNextHopGroup.description: A collection of optional objects to provide per-next hop information for diagnostic purposes.

ciscoIetfPimExtBidirGroup.name: ciscoIetfPimExtBidirGroup
ciscoIetfPimExtBidirGroup.description: A collection of objects to support management of RPs in Bidir mode

ciscoIetfPimExtNotificationGroup.name: ciscoIetfPimExtNotificationGroup
ciscoIetfPimExtNotificationGroup.description: A collection of notification objects to support PIM interface up, PIM interface down, PIM RP mapping change events.

ciscoIetfPimExtNotifEnabledGroup.name: ciscoIetfPimExtNotifEnabledGroup
ciscoIetfPimExtNotifEnabledGroup.description: A collection of objects to indicate whether PIM interface up, PIM interface down, PIM RP mapping change notifications are enabled.
